column4: getting the annoying message "folder contents could not be displayed" when trying to save a document in open office. how do I solve this?
the last folder you saved to was moved or deleted. saving to another folder usually solves that.
it's the first time I'm saving a document. reinstalled ubuntu yesterday
it tries to access a folder that does not exist. perhaps I should try to reinstall openoffice with purge?
what folder does it try to open?
getting 'error stating file: '/home/ubuntu/Documents' it clearly does not exist
try saving something, browsing to an existing folder. close oo, open it again and see if the problem still there.
when I try to save it anyway it says it needs openoffice.org-java-common. really neccessary? nope. that's not my username. but I
I'm using eeebuntu on a eeepc 901. perhaps something wrong with that system. can be solved if I reinstall openoffice with purge?
probably. is it a fresh install?
don't really know about an eee-pc setup. what version of ubuntu are you using?
eeeubuntu. no problems at all on my other HP laptop running ubuntu
